title: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act Request: Full Disclosure for CHRO Case No. 2410220 (Department of Social Services)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Subject: Connecticut Freedom of Information Act Request: Full Disclosure for CHRO Case No. 2410220

To: Freedom of Information Officers
Connecticut Commission on Human Rights and Opportunities (CHRO)
CC:

Connecticut Department of Social Services (DSS) FOIA Officer
U.S. Department of Justice Civil Rights Division
Office of the Inspector General
ADA Compliance Authorities
Senators Richard Blumenthal and Chris Murphy
Governor Ned Lamont
Attorney General William Tong

Dear Freedom of Information Officers and Relevant State Authorities,

Under the Connecticut Freedom of Information Act (C.G.S. §§ 1-200 to 1-242), the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) (42 U.S.C. § 12101 et seq.), and Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act (29 U.S.C. § 794), I hereby request a complete, unredacted disclosure of all records associated with CHRO Case No. 2410220. This FOIA request seeks full transparency in handling ADA compliance, whistleblower protections, and procedural integrity within both CHRO and DSS.

Scope of Requested Records
1. Service of Complaint Documentation
Documentation of Complaint Service: All records detailing the service process for the complaint in CHRO Case 2410220, including dates, methods, confirmation of receipt, and all related communications.
2. Internal and External Communications
Full Communication Records: All emails, letters, memos, text messages, meeting notes, and attachments related to CHRO Case 2410220, particularly communications from:
CHRO and DSS Personnel: Debra Morris, Kimberly D. Morris, Jennifer Nicole Zakrzewski, Michael Slitt, Matthew S. Antonetti, Andrea Barton Reeves, and Judge Dr. Cherron Payne.
Oversight Authorities: Senator Richard Blumenthal, Senator Chris Murphy, Governor Ned Lamont, and Attorney General William Tong.
Correspondence with Federal and State Oversight Entities: Communications addressing ADA accommodations, procedural handling, and whistleblower protections.
3. Case Handling and Decision-Making Documentation
Procedural Records: Internal reports, case logs, workflow charts, and decision-making records for CHRO Case No. 2410220. Include any policies, protocols, or legal criteria applied in the review and adjudication processes.
4. Personnel Documentation and Oversight Records
Personnel and Role-Specific Documentation: Employment records, job descriptions, ADA compliance training, and performance evaluations for each individual involved in CHRO Case No. 2410220.
Organizational Charts: Charts detailing each role and responsibility relevant to oversight of this case.
5. Final Decision, Findings, and Resolutions
Decision Records: Finalized findings, conclusions, and any documentation regarding corrective actions taken as a result of CHRO Case No. 2410220.
6. Financial and Operational Data Related to Case Handling
Budget and Expenditure Reports: All financial records and budgets for CHRO Case No. 2410220, including funds allocated for ADA compliance and FOIA processing.
7. Compliance and Consumer Rights Records
ADA and Consumer Protection Documentation: Records verifying ADA compliance, consumer protection standards, and civil rights obligations relevant to CHRO Case No. 2410220.
8. Complaint Histories and Retaliation Protections
Complaint and Investigation Records: Prior complaints, whistleblower claims, retaliation protections, and investigations involving personnel associated with CHRO Case No. 2410220.
Accommodations for Accessibility
In compliance with ADA and Section 504 standards, I request the following accommodations:

Platform-Based Communication Only: Respond via MuckRock’s platform for transparent communication and tracking purposes.
Full Text in Email Body and Attachment: Provide the full text of your response in the email body, with attached documents individually labeled by category and date for ease of review.
Accessible Document Formatting: Attach all records as individually labeled PDFs organized by category and date. Each document should be clearly indexed for reference.
Complete and Transparent Documentation: Provide unredacted records unless legally required. For necessary redactions, cite specific legal exemptions and include summaries where possible.
Detailed Justifications for Redactions or Denials: Cite the specific legal statute or exemption used for each redaction or denial.
Guidance for Complex Records: Provide summaries or simplified explanations for records containing specialized financial, legal, or procedural terminology.
Identification of Responsible Personnel: List the names, titles, and MuckRock platform contact information for all FOIA officers, decision-makers, or supervisory personnel involved in this request.
Confirmation of Accommodation Compliance: Confirm receipt of this request and acknowledge that each accommodation listed will be applied in all responses and communications.
Request for Expedited Processing
Due to significant public interest in ADA compliance and protections, I request expedited processing of this FOIA request as permitted by 5 U.S.C. § 552(a)(6)(E) and Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-210(a).

Legal Standards for Compliance
This request is based on:

Connecticut FOIA (C.G.S. §§ 1-200 to 1-242) – Ensuring full, prompt access to public records.
ADA (42 U.S.C. § 12101 et seq.) – Guaranteeing equitable access for individuals with disabilities.
Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act (29 U.S.C. § 794) – Ensuring ADA-compliant access to public agency records.
Immediate Response Requirement
Please confirm receipt of this request within 3 business days and provide a compliance timeline within 10 business days. Failure to fulfill these requirements or accommodation requests may result in further federal and state-level oversight actions.

Thank you for ensuring transparency, accessibility, and full compliance in addressing this FOIA request.

Sincerely,
David Medeiros
Filed via MuckRock Platform

I also request that, if possible and pursuant to Conn. Gen. Stat. § 1-212(d), fees be waived as I believe this request is in the public interest and not made for commercial gain. The requested documents will be made available to the public at MuckRock.com.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 4 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

DAVID MEDEIROS
